bibl.title: The Vindolanda Tablets and the Ancient Economy
bibl.note: Diss. Lancaster Univ., 2009. - Introduction. - 1. The Ancient Economy: Historiography and Theory. - 2. The Economy of Roman Britain: Evidence and Historiography. - 3. Market Activity: Traders and Entrepreneurs. - 4. Redistribution: No Beer, No Bravery. - 5. Reciprocity: The 'Social Economy' of a Military Community. - 6. The Making of a Model: Layers and Levels of Economic Activity. - Epilogue. - Pp. 52-72: Appendix. [Table of transactions attested in Tab. Vindol.] - Bibliography.
bibl.seg: Kasper Grønlund Evers, The Vindolanda Tablets and the Ancient Economy = British Archaeological Reports. British Series. 544.
Oxford, Archaeopress, 2011, 4°, vi-77 pp., 1 tabl., 4 figg. ISBN 978-1-4073-0842-5. £27.

Diss. Lancaster Univ., 2009. - Introduction. - 1. The Ancient Economy: Historiography and Theory. - 2. The Economy of Roman Britain: Evidence and Historiography. - 3.
